Headline: TECHNICALLY SPEAKING: CME Holdings, Google Hold Their Own
Story: By Stephen Cox, CMT     A Dow Jones Newswires Column     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--The U.S. stock market has been edging higher since mid-March, after being hit with a nearly month-long correction.   Two notably rich shares in that market, those of Chicago Mercantile Exchange Holdings Inc. (CME) and Google Inc. (GOOG), suggest that the market is still good to go on the upside, and the corrections on the way may be relatively shallow, even if upside progress may be slow once trading resumes next week.       CME Holdings On Hold     CME said on Tuesday that it is postponing a shareholder vote on the company's merger with CBOT Holdings Inc. (BOT). During the postponement, CBOT Holdings will review a competing bid from IntercontinentalExchange Inc. (ICE).   I imagine that CBOT Holdings, which evidently wants a change, may be anxious to ink a deal with a company that doesn't have that obnoxious echolalic "holdings" in its title.   In any case, it may be notable that CME shares, notwithstanding their over-$20 run-up this week, are likewise on hold.   It's true that the shares have been trending higher since December 2002 when they put in a major bottom at $38.90. The uptrend high is the lofty $596.30 resistance level recorded in January. But it's also that the uptrend since the April 2005 low of $163.80 was interrupted early last month when shares fell below $554.76.   As of this writing, the shares are trading at $553.50. The technical point is that an uptrend would be restored on the weekly chart next week only if shares rallied decisively above $573.56.   In other words, absent such a rally, CME shares would be vulnerable to a dip to $521.85. An extended lower move would be targeting $493.64-$475.62 support.   Shares of IntercontinentalExchange, by the way, now at $128.88, are technically strong above $126.73. A move above $127.83 would point them up to $137.07-$139.14 resistance, including a potential top at $138.08. Traders could look for a pullback from $132.93 resistance on the way up.       Google Searches For An Uptrend     Google shares ended a nearly two-month corrective downtrend when they completed a breakout above $442.79 on March 20. The uptrend that followed brought shares up to $474.25 on Tuesday. Current trading near $471.51 shows that shares, technically, are holding the gains. An uptrend would be intact on the daily chart as long as shares trade above $468.12-$465.82 support.   Decisive trading above $473.89 would be the signal for an initial move up to $499.18 resistance, which charts suggest may be an important short-term top. But a move beyond $499.18 would give the stock a shot at its long-term uptrend high of $513.00.   The risk for buyers now is a dip below $468.12-$465.82 support and a selloff to $453.89-$452.12 support.     (Stephen Cox, a chartered market technician, is chief technician for Dow Jones Newswires.)   -By Stephen Cox, Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-2064; stephen.cox@dowjones.com   Data by CQG, CSI, Commodity Research Bureau, TradeStation Securities     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 13:00 ET (17:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Pacific WebWorks Reports 2006 Year End Results
Story: SALT LAKE CITY--(BUSINESS WIRE)--April 06, 2007--   Pacific WebWorks, Inc. (OTCBB:PWEB) reported revenues of $5,043,226 for the year ended December 31, 2006. This represents a nearly 15% decrease in revenues reported for the same period in 2005. The decrease was expected and is a result of the previously announced transition in marketing strategies completed during the final six months of 2006.     CEO Ken Bell stated, "As announced last year, the company discontinued its capital intensive and high risk nationwide sales events in July of 2006. Since that time we have transitioned the sales and marketing of our products and services to an Internet focused marketing strategy. That transition has gone very well and we will begin reporting results based on this model beginning with our 1st quarter 10-Q. However, as expected, revenues suffered somewhat during the transition period. We expect to see revenues recovering by the 2nd quarter of 2007."     Bell continued, "Additionally, after a thorough analysis of market conditions and projected revenues associated with our Intellipay gateway operation, we determined that it is appropriate to impair the carrying value of Intellipay by $1 million. This represents an entirely non-cash charge to our financial statements and does not in any way effect our actual cash flows. Absent that non-cash charge, losses for 2006 would have been down dramatically from 2005."     "We continue to make progress in Intellipay where we now have 45 municipalities using our Caselle associated accounting software and our transaction processing revenue is increasing each month," Bell concluded.       About Pacific WebWorks, Intellipay and TradeWorks Marketing     Pacific WebWorks provides a comprehensive suite of affordable, easy-to-use software programs for small businesses that want to create, manage, and maintain an effective Web strategy including full e-commerce capabilities.     Pacific WebWorks' wholly owned subsidiary IntelliPay develops and provides trusted electronic transaction processing and payment products and services.     Pacific WebWorks' wholly owned subsidiary TradeWorks Marketing is a sales and marketing organization created to market Pacific WebWorks and IntelliPay products.     Forward-Looking Statements: This press release contains certain forward-looking statements. Investors are cautioned that certain statements in this release are "forward-looking statements" and involve both known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors. Such uncertainties include, among others, certain risks associated with the operation of the company described above. The company's actual results could differ materially from expected results.        CONTACT: Pacific WebWorks, Inc.               Brett Bell, 801-578-9020        SOURCE: Pacific WebWorks, Inc.  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 09:30 ET (13:30 GMT)

Headline: : Avocent Corporation Announces Estimated Revenues for First Quarter 2007
Story: HUNTSVILLE, Ala.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--April 06, 2007--   Avocent Corporation (NASDAQ: AVCT) announced today that it expects first quarter revenues to be within a range of $132 to $135 million compared with $94.5 million reported in the first quarter of 2006 and compared to pro forma revenue of approximately $131 million for the first quarter of 2006. (The pro forma revenue assumes that both LANDesk and Cyclades, two companies acquired during 2006, had been owned for the entire first quarter of 2006.)     The LANDesk Division's revenues increased 5% to 7% to approximately $23.5 to $24 million and the Management Systems Division's revenues increased 1% to approximately $105 million. "Revenue was below our expectations due to several factors including some softness in overall IT spending and the related slowing of channel activity, project delays by some customers and a lower level of economic activity than we had expected," stated John R. Cooper, chairman and chief executive officer of Avocent Corporation.     "While we have noted that some organizations have reduced their forecasts of IT spending in recent weeks, our own experience to this point indicates that projects remain planned and budgeted but have been delayed in some cases as customers take additional time to contemplate industry developments and, to some extent, macroeconomic factors," concluded Mr. Cooper.     Avocent will provide an on-line, real-time webcast and conference call on Monday, April 9, 2007 at 7:00 a.m. Central time to answer questions regarding this release. The live broadcast will be available on-line at www.avocent.com as well as at www.investorcalendar.com. The on-line replay will follow immediately and continue for 30 days.     Avocent expects to announce its first quarter results on April 19, 2007. Avocent will host a conference call and webcast on that date to discuss the quarter's results in more detail.       About Avocent Corporation     Avocent delivers IT operations and infrastructure management solutions for enterprises worldwide, helping customers to reduce costs and simplify complex IT environments via integrated, centralized in-band and out-of-band hardware and software. Through LANDesk, Avocent also is a leading provider of systems, security, and process management solutions. Additional information is available at: www.avocent.com.       Forward-Looking Statements     This press release contains statements that are forward-looking statements as defined within the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. These include statements regarding our expectations of the final revenue results for the first quarter of 2007, the expected announcement date of our first quarter results, and expected trends in IT spending by other organizations and our outlook regarding the closing of planned projects and related sales. These forward-looking statements are subject to risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from the statements made, including the risks associated with general economic conditions, risks attributable to future product demand, sales, and expenses, risks associated with reliance on a limited number of customers, component suppliers, and single source components, risks associated with acquisitions and acquisition integration, risks associated with product design efforts and the introduction of new products and technologies, and risks associated with obtaining and protecting intellectual property rights. Other factors that could cause operating and financial results to differ are described in our annual report on Form 10-K filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on March 1, 2007. Other risks may be detailed from time to time in reports to be filed with the SEC. Avocent does not undertake any obligation to publicly update its forward-looking statements based on events or circumstances after the date hereof. Blankenship, 256-217-1301               Senior Vice President of Finance               and Chief Financial Officer        SOURCE: Avocent Corporation  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 17:18 ET (21:18 GMT)

Headline: : ACE USA to Conduct Regional Educational Seminar; Program Offers Insurance & Risk Management Solutions for Defense Base Act (DBA) Workers Comp Coverage
Story: PHILADELPHIA--(BUSINESS WIRE)--April 06, 2007--   ACE USA, the U.S.-based retail operating division of the ACE Group of Companies, today announced that its ACE USA Washington D.C. branch office team will be hosting an educational seminar for brokers and risk managers regarding insurance solutions and risk management issues and concerns faced by companies doing business overseas. The program will include a discussion of risk management issues in dealing with the Defense Base Act (DBA) Workers Compensation Act. The seminar program will be held at The U.S. Navy Memorial & Navy Heritage Center in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday, May 9, 2007, 10:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m., with registration beginning at 9:30 a.m.     The following is the list of confirmed presenters and the topics to be covered:       --  Keith Flicker, Attorney, Flicker, Garelick & Associates LLP -          Scope of DBA coverage       --  Robin Smith, DBA Claims Manager, ACE USA International &          Specialty Group - Claims-handling issues       --  William House, Senior Vice President, ACE USA International &          Specialty Group - Capture and detention claims       --  Frank D'Ancona, Vice President, ACE Accident and Health - War          risk coverages.       --  John Ingram, Vice President, ESIS, Inc. - Demonstration of          ESIS e-risk Manager(SM)       --  Jean McDermott-Lucey, Vice President, ACE Professional Risk -          Kidnap & extortion risk management issues     Keith Flicker, of Flicker, Garelick & Associates, LLP, a leading national law firm that handles DBA cases, will discuss DBA requirements, the high cost of injured worker cases, and how to evaluate a carrier's DBA coverage. In addition, the seminar will feature ACE USA speakers who will review ACE USA's DBA Workers Compensation claims reporting capabilities, Accidental Death and Dismemberment companion coverages and Kidnap & Extortion coverages and products. There will also be an opportunity to preview ACE USA's online DBA claims reporting capabilities offered by ESIS(R), the risk management services arm of ACE USA, which offers dedicated claims professionals with specialized knowledge of the complexities involved in administering DBA claims, and provides in-depth risk analysis, vulnerability, threat assessment, and risk control services in support of this coverage.     "We're pleased to offer this ongoing series of education programs to brokers and risk managers who wish to learn more about the unique risks faced by government prime and sub-contractors doing business overseas in potentially hazardous business locations, and the specific legal and insurance coverage requirements associated with DBA Workers Compensation coverage," said Patricia Goudarzi, Senior Vice President and ACE USA Washington, D.C. Metro and Maryland Branch Manager. "This panel forum offers brokers and risk managers the opportunity to tap into the expertise of insurance, risk management and legal professionals and learn more about the coverage needed to operate in this rapidly changing market."     To register for the seminar, please contact Patricia Goudarzi at (202) 471-2911 or patricia.goudarzi@ace-ina.com. The seminar is open to existing and potential ACE USA customers and insurance brokers.     ACE USA is the U.S.-based retail operating division of The ACE Group of Companies, headed by ACE Limited (NYSE:ACE), and is rated A+ (Superior) by A.M. Best Company and A+ (Strong) by Standard & Poor's. ACE USA, through its underwriting companies, provides insurance products and services throughout the U.S. Additional information on ACE USA and its products and services can be found at www.ace-ina.com. The ACE Group of Companies provides insurance and reinsurance for a diverse group of clients around the world. All products may not be available in all states, and surplus lines products are only available through licensed surplus lines brokers.        CONTACT: ACE North America Communications               Carla Ferrara, 215-640-4744               carla.ferrara@ace-ina.com        SOURCE: ACE USA  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 12:42 ET (16:42 GMT)

Headline: : Royal Caribbean Announces 2008-09 Itineraries From Major Northeast Ports
Story: East Coast Travelers Within Easy Reach of a Royal Caribbean Cruise Adventure       MIAMI, April 6 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Royal Caribbean International has opened bookings for 19 exciting 2008-09 itineraries, offering East Coast travelers more voyages and embarkation ports to experience a cruise vacation. More than 80 sailings, ranging from five to 15 nights will sail to New England/ Canada, Bermuda, and Eastern Caribbean. The new itineraries will give New York-metropolitan area travelers convenient year-round cruise choices from Cape Liberty Cruise Port in Bayonne, NJ. Travelers also will enjoy summer and autumn sailings from Baltimore, Norfolk and Boston aboard Grandeur of the Seas and Jewel of the Seas.     "Travelers from the East Coast now have more convenient choices than ever to escape on an exciting Royal Caribbean cruise," said Lisa Bauer, senior vice president, Sales, Royal Caribbean International. "Guests can enjoy voyages aboard some of the world's most innovative ships as they visit scenic New England and Canadian coastlines or get away to the warmth of the Caribbean and Bermuda."     Throughout 2008-09, travelers from the New York and New Jersey regions will continue to have convenient sailings year-round from Cape Liberty Cruise Port aboard Explorer of the Seas. She will sail on eight distinct roundtrip itineraries ranging from five to 12 nights to Bermuda, and Eastern and Southern Caribbean. Northeast travelers also can choose among six sailings to New England and Canada on nine-night voyages. Prices start at $649 per person, double occupancy.     "We are thrilled to bring Grandeur of the Seas to the cities of Norfolk, Virginia and Baltimore, Maryland in 2008," Bauer added. "The Royal Caribbean itineraries from these two major home ports complement the variety of cruising options available to travelers along the Eastern Seaboard."     Grandeur will sail roundtrip from Norfolk's newly constructed Half Moone Cruise and Celebration Center on five-night Bermuda cruise getaways, eight- and nine-night voyages to New England and Canada, and nine-night Eastern Caribbean sailings. From Baltimore, Grandeur will sail roundtrip on five-night voyages to Bermuda and nine-night cruise vacations to the Eastern Caribbean. Prices start at $649 per person, double occupancy.     Jewel of the Seas returns to Boston in 2008. Travelers can enjoy the changing of the foliage and the vivid autumn colors of the New England landscape from the historic port on four roundtrip seven-night sailings to New England and Canada beginning on September 20, 2008. In addition, Boston-area travelers also can choose a shortened itinerary on one five-night sailing on October 13. Prices start at $549 per person, double occupancy.     Other 2008 Royal Caribbean itineraries also open for individual, group and incentive bookings this week are four 14- or 15-night Panama Canal voyages, aboard Radiance of the Seas and Serenade of the Seas.     Royal Caribbean International is a global cruise brand with 20 ships currently in service and three under construction.  Liberty of the Seas, the cruise line's newest ship, which debuts in April 2007, will share the title of largest cruise ship at sea with sister ship Freedom of the Seas. At 160,000 GRT with a capacity of 3,634 guests double-occupancy, Liberty of the Seas will sail alternating Eastern and Western Caribbean itineraries from Miami. The line also offers unique land-tour vacations in Alaska, Canada, Europe and Australia through its cruisetour division.  For additional information or to make reservations, go to www.royalcaribbean.com or call (800) 327-6700. For travel professionals, go to www.cruisingpower.com or call (800) 327-2056.    SOURCE  Royal Caribbean International       /CONTACT: Tracy Quan, +1-305-539-6577, tquan@rccl.com, or Harrison Liu, +1-305-982-2363, hliu@rccl.com, both of Royal Caribbean International      /Web site: http://www.royalcaribbean.com      /Web site: http://www.cruisingpower.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 11:18 ET (15:18 GMT)

Headline: UPDATE: Google, Agence France-Presse Sign Deal, Settle Suit
Story: (Updates with quotes from AFP.)     NEW YORK (AP)--Agence France-Presse, a global news agency based in Paris, has settled its lawsuit against Google Inc. (GOOG) and will allow the Internet search leader to post news and photos from AFP journalists.   The deal, announced Friday, settles the copyright infringement lawsuit that AFP filed in March 2005 accusing Google of posting news summaries, headlines and photos without permission.   Financial details of the settlement were not disclosed.   The deal will allow Google to use headlines and photos on Google News and other services that drive online traffic to sites displaying AFP news. The companies didn't disclose where else AFP's news would be used by Google.   Google settled a separate dispute with The Associated Press last August. At that time the two companies disclosed a new business relationship under which Google will pay AP for news and photos, but financial details of that arrangement weren't disclosed.   Eric Scherer, AFP's director for strategic planning and partnerships, said the wire service is pleased because "the work of our journalists and photographers will be recognized in a normal way," he said.   "With the other major Internet players like AOL, Yahoo or MSN, we have been licensing our content to them for years and years," he said. "And now Google has agreed to do the same thing, so we are very happy."   Scherer said he could not provide further details.   Representatives for Google did not immediately reply to an e-mail request for further comment on the deal.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 12:38 ET (16:38 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: US Judge Tells Vonage It Can't Seek New Customers -2-
Story: Two weeks ago, Hilton imposed an injunction against Vonage but said he would give the company two weeks to present the case for a stay.   Protesting against the ruling, Vonage attorney Roger Warin said the decision "would be the difference between cutting off oxygen as opposed to a blow to the head" of the company.   Hilton replied that Vonage had every right to seek to overturn the stay on appeal.   Hilton said he had weighed a number of factors in reaching his decision. These, he said, included whether a stay could in fact lead to Vonage's bankruptcy. He also said he had to evaluate how the public's interest would be affected and concluded that given the competitiveness of the telecommunications industry, there would be no impact either way.     -By Corey Boles, Dow Jones Newswires; 202-862-6637; corey.boles@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 11:22 ET (15:22 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: 2nd UPDATE:Telecom Italia Chmn Rossi Quits; Buora To Step In
Story: (Updates that Deputy Chairman Carlo Buora will take over Rossi's powers until a new chairman is named)     MILAN (Dow Jones)--Telecom Italia SpA (TIT.MI) Chairman Guido Rossi resigned Friday, two days after the company's largest shareholder, Pirelli & C. SpA (PC.MI) moved to oust Rossi because of a conflict over strategy.   Telecom Italia Deputy Chairman Carlo Buora will take on Rossi's position as chairman until a new one can be named, a person familiar with the matter told Dow Jones Newswires Friday.   Rossi Wednesday had said he wouldn't resign even if Pirelli chose to oust him, but by Thursday, newspaper La Repubblica reported that Rossi was considering resigning.   The news follows a period of stormy relations between Pirelli Chairman Marco Tronchetti Provera and Rossi over strategy and over Tronchetti Provera's several attempts to sell his controlling stake to foreign telecoms operators.   Tronchetti Provera's aim to exit Telecom has brought him into open conflict with Prime Minister Romano Prodi since Prodi is keen to see the company remain in Italian hands. That conflict resulted in Tronchetti Provera's resignation as Telecom Italia chairman late last year.   Rossi was brought in as chairman to make peace with the government.   After months of inconclusive talks with potential buyers, Tronchetti Provera stunned the business community last week when he announced a possible deal with America's AT&T (T) and Mexico's America Movil (AMOV).   Cabinet ministers, reacting to the announcement, have called for another solution that would protect the company from possible foreign control.   Tronchetti Provera's moves have also angered other Telecom Italia shareholders.   Two of Telecom Italia's largest shareholders, Mediobanca SpA (MB.MI) and Assicurazioni Generali SpA (G.MI), said late Wednesday they hadn't been consulted by Pirelli on management changes. Mediobanca was not consulted on the AT&T talks either, another person familiar with the matter said.   Olimpia, an unlisted holding, shares control of Telecom Italia under a shareholders' pact with investment bank Mediobanca and insurer Generali, which together own 5.2%.   France Telecom (FTE) and Telefonica SA (TEF) are considering individual counteroffers to tentative bids by AT&T Inc. and America Movil SA de CV for a combined 66.6% stake in Olimpia.   In addition to those potential buyers, Italian bank Intesa Sanpaolo SpA (ISNPY) said it is ready to team up with other financial institutions to end the battle for control of Telecom Italia and keep the company in Italian hands, without ruling out a partnership with AT&T and America Movil.   Mediobanca is being pressured by the government and other members of Italy's business establishment to find a "national solution," a person familiar with the matter told Dow Jones Newswires earlier this week.   Tronchetti Provera's proposed replacement for Rossi is Pasquale Pistorio, a Telecom Italia director and former chairman of semiconductor firm STMicroelectronics NV (STM), according to people familiar with the matter.     -By Jennifer Clark, Dow Jones Newswires; 39 335 833 5761; jennifer.clark@dowjones.com   (Jonathan Vuocolo, Jason Singer, Gabriel Kahn, Giada Zampano and Sabrina Cohen contributed to this story)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 12:01 ET (16:01 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: US STOCKS VIEW: Jobs Report May Hurt US Shares Next Week
Story: By Ciara Linnane     A Dow Jones Column     A stronger-than-expected March jobs report will probably hurt U.S. stocks when investors have their first chance to react to the numbers on Monday.   Traders will likely drive shares lower when they return from the Easter holiday, suspecting the Federal Reserve's next move would be to hike rates and not to cut them, strategists said Friday.   Market optimists have been pinning their hopes on the Fed swooping in to rescue the weak U.S. economy with a rate cut. Lower rates would also help the housing sector, the market's main focus of concern as the meltdown in the subprime mortgage market continues with defaults on home payments and foreclosures surging.   "Right now, bad news is good news for equities. We're really looking for the Fed to cut rates sooner rather than later," said Stephen Sachs, head of trading at Rydex Investments. "Anything that upsets those hopes is bad for the stock market."   The Labor Department said Friday that the economy added 180,000 jobs in March, above the 168,000 jobs expected from a MarketWatch poll of economists. The jobless rate fell to 4.4% from 4.5% in February, against expectations it would remain unchanged.   Average hourly earnings rose an expected 0.3%, putting the annual rate at 4%. That's down from the 4.3% pace seen in December but still well above the Fed's comfort zone. Wage growth is a chief concern of Fed policymakers, who fear that wage pressures could nurture an inflationary psychology in the economy.   The shift in interest rate expectations was reflected in Federal funds futures, which fell after the report. The slim odds the market had priced in for near-term rate cuts have been almost erased. The May contract is indicating the rate will remain at 5.25% in May, while the July contract is pricing in a 12% chance for a rate cut to 5% at the June meeting, down from 20% odds Thursday. Treasurys tumbled Friday in a shortened trading session in New York.   "We still look for the Fed to remain sidelined through the summer, but see better risk that the next Fed move will be a boost in rates, rather than a cut before year end," said analysts at research firm Action Economics.   The jobs report will set the tone for next week's trade but it's not the only important piece of data, according to Charles Campbell, head of sales at Miller Tabak.   The minutes from the Federal Reserve's last meeting will be released on Wednesday and could revive worry that the Fed is focused on fighting inflation to the detriment of the economy, he said.   The producer price index due on Friday "could be a problem, too, if inflation is too strong," he said.   Next week also sees the launch of the first-quarter earnings season with aluminum giant Alcoa Inc. scheduled to report results after the bell Tuesday.   And then there's the broader political picture to consider, Campbell said.   "You still have Iran as an issue and you still have Syria," he said. "These problems are not going away."   U.S. stocks closed the shortened week higher on Thursday. The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJI) gained 1.7% on the week. The S&P 500 (SPX) rose 1.6% and the Nasdaq composite (RIXF) enjoyed a 2.1% gain.       Earnings Back in Focus     Alcoa (AA) is expected to report earnings of 75 cents a share when it publishes results for the first three months of the year on Tuesday afternoon, according to estimates from Thomson Financial.   Earnings are expected to slow from the fourth quarter when they climbed 58% -- or 111% excluding one-time items.   On the plus side, resurgent aluminum prices are again likely to underpin profits at Alcoa, which is now vying with Russia's UC Rusal for the title of the world's largest aluminum producer.   But Alcoa encountered some rough ground over the quarter, including a general strike in Guinea where it has a joint venture producing bauxite, or aluminum ore.   Credit Suisse analyst David Gagliano cited the strike and increased start-up costs at a smelter in Iceland when he cut his first-quarter profit forecast by five cents to 76 cents a share in a note published Thursday.   The other heavyweight earnings report due next week is from General Electric Co. (GE), which will release its results on Friday before the market opens.   Given GE's strong role as a financial services provider, and as the fifth-biggest subprime lender in the U.S., traders will be looking for clues on just how far the meltdown in the subprime mortgage market stretches into the lending industry.   GE likely isn't in danger of missing its consensus, as its net exposure to the riskier lending section of the mortgage market is relatively low, but the quarter's "puts and takes," including restructuring costs, will be evaluated closely.   Analysts polled by Thomson Financial forecast earnings, on average, of 44 cents a share, the middle of GE's own estimate of 43 cents to 45 cents a share.   Analyst forecast sales at the Fairfield, Conn., maker of industrial and consumer products at $39.8 billion, which would be an increase of more than 5% over the prior year's first quarter.   Overall corporate earnings expectations for this quarter are gloomy with most analysts forecasting an end to the record 14 consecutive quarters of company earnings rising more than 10% on average.   Thomson Financial is expecting S&P 500 companies to achieve average earnings growth of about 4%. At Zacks Research, the forecast is for 8.3% growth.   Also dampening earnings strength in the first quarter are comparisons with the year-ago period, when some big companies benefited from a post-Hurricane Katrina construction boom, said Zacks senior market analyst Charles Rotblut.   "In general the economy was a little bit stronger last year than it was this year," he said.       Economic Spotlight     The economic calendar is light next week although some key reports are slated for release, starting Wednesday with the latest Fed meeting minutes.   Economists polled by MarketWatch are expecting the March import price index due Thursday to rise 0.8% after 0.2% in February.   On Friday, the February trade gap is expected to widen to $60.2 billion from $59.1 billion in January.   The producer price index is expected to climb 1% in March after rising 1.3% in February. Core producer prices - excluding food and energy prices - are expected to climb 0.2% after a 0.4% rise in February.     (Ciara Linnane is markets editor for MarketWatch in New York.)     -By Ciara Linnane, 415-439-6400; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 14:27 ET (18:27 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Abbott Announces FDA Approval of a New Coated Niaspan Tablet
Story: ABBOTT PARK, Ill., April 6 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has approved Abbott's new coated Niaspan(R) (niacin extended-release tablets).  Niaspan is the leading medication for boosting HDL cholesterol -- the "good" cholesterol.     Heart disease is the leading cause of death in both men and women in the United States, and studies have shown that every 1 percent increase in HDL cholesterol is associated with a 2 percent decrease in heart disease risk.     "Niaspan has the proven ability to elevate good cholesterol, a known risk factor in cardiovascular disease," said Eugene Sun, M.D., vice president of Global Pharmaceutical Clinical Development, Abbott.  "With the FDA approval of a new Niaspan coated tablet, our next step is to expand upon two published studies to determine the effect on flushing intensity.  We'll do that by initiating larger clinical studies."     Niaspan is the only FDA-approved, once-daily extended-release prescription niacin formulation for the treatment of lipid disorders with an ability to significantly raise HDL cholesterol.  Collective results from three major clinical studies show an average 22 percent increase of HDL for patients receiving 2000 mg of Niaspan at bedtime.  Niacin is also indicated for the secondary prevention of heart attacks, and in combination with a bile acid binding resin, niacin is indicated to promote regression of coronary atherosclerosis in patients with history of coronary artery disease.     "More and more, physicians and their patients understand that good cholesterol management means trying to bring all lipid parameters to optimal levels," said Richard Karas, M.D., Ph.D., professor of medicine, Tufts-New England Medical Center, Boston, MA.  "Introducing a new coated tablet that may enhance patient convenience is an important factor in improving our ability to provide good cholesterol management for our patients," he added.        About Niaspan     Available since 1997, Niaspan is the only FDA-approved, once-daily extended-release prescription formulation of niacin for treating abnormal cholesterol levels.        Indications     Niaspan is indicated as an adjunct to diet when the response to a diet restricted in saturated fat and cholesterol and other nonpharmacologic measures alone has been inadequate, to reduce elevated total cholesterol, LDL- C, Apo B, and triglyceride levels, and to increase HDL-C in patients with primary hypercholesterolemia and mixed dyslipidemia.  In patients with a history of myocardial infarction and hypercholesterolemia, niacin is indicated to reduce the risk of recurrent non-fatal myocardial infarction or in patients with coronary artery disease and hypercholesterolemia, niacin, in combination with a bile acid binding resin, is indicated to slow progression or promote regression of atherosclerotic disease.        Important Safety Information     Niaspan is contraindicated in patients with allergies to any of its ingredients, active peptic ulcer disease, significant or unexplained persistent liver dysfunction, or arterial bleeding.  Niaspan should not be substituted for equivalent doses of immediate-release niacin.  Niaspan should be prescribed with caution in patients who consume substantial amounts of alcohol and/or have a past history of liver disease.  Liver function tests should be performed on all patients during therapy with Niaspan.  Use of Niaspan with other lipid-altering medications called statins may increase the risk of rhabdomyolysis, a rare condition that causes muscles to breakdown. The most common side effect with Niaspan is flushing of the skin.  Patients with diabetes should carefully monitor their blood sugar and report changes to their doctor.  Other commonly reported side effects include indigestion, headache, pain, abdominal pain, nausea, itching, diarrhea, runny nose, vomiting and rash.     More information about Niaspan, including full prescribing information, is available on the Web site www.rxabbott.com/pdf/niaspan.pdf or by calling Abbott Medical Information at 1-800-633-9110.        About Abbott     Abbott (NYSE: ABT) is a global, broad-based health care company devoted to the discovery, development, manufacture and marketing of pharmaceuticals and medical products, including nutritionals, devices and diagnostics.  The company employs 65,000 people and markets its products in more than 130 countries.     Abbott's news releases and other information are available on the company's Web site at www.abbott.com.    SOURCE  Abbott       /CONTACT: DeAnna DuBose, +1-847-938-9002, or Laureen Cassidy, +1-847-938-7743, Financial: Lawrence J. Peepo, +1-847-935-6722, all of Abbott      /Web site: http://www.abbott.com      /Web site: http://www.rxabbott.com/pdf/niaspan.pdf     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 14:00 ET (18:00 GMT)

Headline: : NetFires LLC Precision Attack Missile Launch Paves the Way for Complete System Testing
Story: TUCSON, Ariz., April 6, 2007 /PRNewswire/ -- NetFires LLC, a joint venture between Raytheon Company's (NYSE: RTN) Missile Systems business and Lockheed Martin (NYSE: LMT) Missiles and Fire Control, successfully launched a Non Line-of-Sight-Launch System Precision Attack Missile April 4 at White Sands Missile Range, N.M., taking the missile system a significant step toward full- up missile testing planned for later this year.     After a successful launch from a tactical Non Line-of-Sight-Launch System Container Launch Unit, the Precision Attack Missile enhanced ballistic test vehicle -- equipped with a telemetry system in place of a warhead and a high- fidelity mass stimulant seeker -- completed the launch sequence and transitioned to flight.     The enhanced ballistic test vehicle missile's wings and fins deployed, the Non Line-of-Sight-Launch System navigational system successfully operated, and the thrust vector control system and control actuator system controlled the airframe. Additionally, the telemetry system, battery system, air data system and propulsion system functioned properly.     "Our program approach is to test early and test often to ensure success," said Scott Speet, executive vice president of the NetFires LLC and Raytheon's Non Line-of-Sight-Launch System program director. "This test provides the Non Line-of-Sight-Launch System team an early look before full-up missile integration and builds for future test flights."     "This successful flight test is a first step to providing our warfighters the critical, cost-effective, long-range, precision capability needed to successfully fight in the 21st century battlespace," said Col. Doug Dever, U.S. Army's Non Line-of-Sight-Launch System project manager.     The Non Line-of-Sight-Launch System is one of the 14 Future Combat System's (FCS) core systems. It will operate as a part of the FCS systems-of- systems to meet the requirements of the Army's Future Brigade Combat Teams and provide increased capability for the current force's modular Brigade Combat Teams. It is also one of the key littoral combat ship mission modules. Compared to systems with equivalent firepower (kills per combat load), the Non Line-of-Sight-Launch System provides a modular, highly deployable and flexible precision fires capability to the U.S. Army, Navy and joint maneuver forces for a very low life-cycle system cost.     Raytheon Company, with 2006 sales of $20.3 billion, is a technology leader specializing in defense, homeland security and other government markets throughout the world. With a history of innovation spanning more than 80 years, Raytheon provides state-of-the-art electronics, mission systems integration and other capabilities in the areas of sensing; effects; and command, control, communications and intelligence systems, as well as a broad range of mission support services. With headquarters in Waltham, Mass., Raytheon employs 73,000 people worldwide.     Headquartered in Bethesda, Md., Lockheed Martin employs about 140,000 people worldwide and is principally engaged in the research, design, development, manufacture, and integration and sustainment of advanced technology systems, products and services.          Contacts:      Raytheon                        Lockheed Martin      Everett Tackett, APR            Craig Vanbebber      520.794.9494                    972.603.1615    SOURCE  Raytheon Company       /CONTACT: Everett Tackett, APR of Raytheon, +1-520-794-9494; or Craig Vanbebber of Lockheed Martin, +1-972-603-1615      /Web site: http://www.raytheon.com      /Web site: http://www.lockheedmartin.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 12:01 ET (16:01 GMT)

Headline: TIP SHEET: Babson's Fields Fends Off Risk In Risky Bonds
Story: By Michael Aneiro     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     (This article was originally published Thursday)     Like many high-yield bond fund managers, Jill Fields hopes to ride the bonds' current bull run as long as possible. But she finds herself increasingly adjusting her holdings to rein in risk, bracing for what many see as an inevitable, and possibly imminent, downturn.   A managing director at Babson Capital Management, where she has worked since 1997, Fields typically divides the high-yield market into three tiers of risk and allocates her investments based on value. Over the past three years, she has been overweight in the riskiest tier of junk bonds, which have rewarded investors with robust yields and outsized returns. Now, with an anticipated increase in default rates looming larger, Fields has shifted some of her portfolio out of the most highly speculative debt and into the middle range of the junk bond market.   At Babson, Fields manages the Mass Mutual Premier High Yield Mutual Fund, a five-star Morningstar-rated fund with $176 million in assets. Mass Mutual Financial Group is the parent company of Babson Capital. Including composite accounts and several separate ones, Fields manages about $550 million in total assets.   Fields' strategy begins with an analysis of an individual company's credit, then she overlays data about that credit's sector along with macroeconomic information. "I'm very much a fundamental value credit investor," she said.   Her forays into riskier territory are guided by a belief in the health of a particular company or, on occasion, its industry. Fields believes that many of the lowest-grade, CCC-rated credits are companies that have stumbled but are capable of rebounding. She notes that investors are often scared off by a CCC rating.   During 2006, one of her fund's top performers was Charter Communications Inc. (CHTR), a CCC-rated cable company but one in which she saw good credit metrics, including a growing subscriber base and improving cash flow.   "We like the outlook for the cable sector in general, so we were willing to go down the credit ladder a bit," she said. One of the biggest positions she took was in Charter and it paid off, returning 51.6% for her fund during 2006, Fields said. She has since sold off some of her holdings in Charter but still maintains a position in the credit and considers it an attractive longer-term investment.   Despite the windfall from Charter, Fields' fund recorded a 12.16% gross increase during 2006 (an 11.3% return after expenses, as measured by Morningstar). That's a solid performance by nearly any measure, but only slightly ahead of the 11.85% performance in the overall junk bond market, according to Lehman Brothers. Fields said she largely avoided what turned out to be the year's most lucrative sectors: airlines, which Fields prefers to avoid based on the industry's troubled history, and auto makers, which entered 2006 on extremely shaky ground.   "The challenge last year was that Ford and GM did very well, and they're such a large part of the (high-yield) index," she said. "As a manager, if you weren't willing to make those big bets, it was tough to outperform the index."   At a time when high-yield bonds' risk premiums - or spreads over Treasury rates - are near record lows, companies are able to cheaply offer increasingly speculative debt to yield-starved investors. Many new deals provide minimal covenant protection to bondholders in case of such events as leveraged buyouts, which can saddle companies with new debt and push existing bondholders lower in the repayment pecking order. Many offerings also are designed to raise money to buy back stock, benefitting shareholders but ratcheting up a company's leverage. With these trends coinciding with a boom in leveraged loans, which are senior to bonds, Fields says she has become particularly circumspect when it comes to new bond issues.   "A lot of new deals we're not participating in," she said. "We have to be comfortable with capital structures. If something's coming with a risky capital structure and not-so-great covenants, we think we can find better value in the secondary market."   Conversely, Fields said, one can find good value in new issues during bear markets, such as the one in 2002, when she shifted more of her allocation to new bonds as companies were forced to pay higher interest rates to come to market.   After months of default rates hovering near historic lows, credit markets have been watching nervously for signs of an economic downturn while trying not to bail out of the highest-yielding bonds too soon. Over the past three months, Fields said, she has become particularly wary of sectors that depend heavily on consumer confidence, moving some of her holdings out of such areas as retail and housing.   Asked how she expects to weather a turn in the credit cycle, Fields points to her fund's performance during the last shakeout. Although defaults skyrocketed from 2002 to 2003, Fields said, her fund's default rate since 2000 is a mere 1.5%, while the default rate for the high-yield index is 8%.   If high yield sees a reversal, she said, she feels confident sticking to her guns.   "It all comes from a bottom-up credit examination," she said. "We want companies that have adequate cash flow and enough hard assets or enterprise value to cover their debts."   (Michael Aneiro covers the high-yield and convertible bond markets for Dow Jones Newswires.)   -By Michael Aneiro, Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-2189; michael.aneiro@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 07:30 ET (11:30 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Celanese Corporation Announces Final Results of Its Modified "Dutch Auction" Tender Offer
Story: DALLAS--(BUSINESS WIRE)--April 06, 2007--   Celanese Corporation (NYSE:CE) today announced the final results of its modified "Dutch Auction" tender offer, which expired at 5:00 p.m., New York City time, on April 3, 2007.     In accordance with the terms and conditions of the tender offer, and based on the final count by Computershare Trust Company, N.A., the depositary for the tender offer, Celanese, through its wholly owned subsidiary Celanese International Holdings Luxembourg S.a r.l., has accepted for purchase 2,021,775 shares of its Series A Common Stock at a purchase price of $30.50 per share, for a total cost of approximately $61.7 million.     Stockholders who properly tendered shares in the tender offer at or below the purchase price will have all of their tendered shares purchased, subject to certain limited exceptions.     Computershare Trust Company, N.A., the depositary for the tender offer, will promptly issue payment for the shares validly tendered and accepted for purchase under the tender offer.     The number of shares that the Company accepted for purchase in the tender offer represents approximately 1.3 percent of its currently outstanding common stock.     In the tender offer, the company offered to purchase up to 11,279,243 shares of its common stock at a price not less than $28.00 nor greater than $30.50 per share, for a maximum aggregate purchase price of up to $344 million.     Also, as previously disclosed in the offer, Celanese, acting through its wholly owned subsidiary Celanese International Holdings Luxembourg S.a r.l., separately agreed to purchase shares of common stock from the investment funds associated with The Blackstone Group, L.P. (which currently own approximately 14% of the Company's outstanding common stock and elected not to participate in the tender offer) such that Blackstone's percentage ownership interest in Celanese would remain substantially unchanged from its interest immediately prior to the tender offer. Based upon the company's acceptance for purchase of the approximately two million shares tendered in the tender offer, Celanese will purchase, through its wholly owned subsidiary, Celanese International Holdings Luxembourg S.a r.l., approximately 329,000 shares from Blackstone, on the eleventh business day following the expiration of the tender offer. The shares acquired from Blackstone will be purchased at the final purchase price of $30.50 per share determined in the tender offer for a total cost of approximately $10 million.     The Company expects to purchase approximately $72 million of its common stock in the tender offer and from Blackstone, representing approximately 1.5 percent of its currently outstanding common stock. The Company has not announced any further actions at this time.     The dealer managers for the tender offer are Merrill Lynch & Co. and Deutsche Bank Securities Inc.; the information agent is Georgeson; and the depositary is Computershare Trust Company, N.A. All inquiries about the tender offer should be directed to the information agent at (866) 314-1598. Banks and brokers may call (212) 440-9800.       About Celanese:     As a global leader in the chemicals industry, Celanese Corporation makes products essential to everyday living. Our products, found in consumer and industrial applications, are manufactured in North America, Europe and Asia. Net sales totaled $6.7 billion in 2006, with over 60% generated outside of North America. Known for operational excellence and execution of its business strategies, Celanese delivers value to customers around the globe with innovations and best-in-class technologies. Based in Dallas, Texas, the company employs approximately 8,900 employees worldwide. For more information on Celanese Corporation, please visit the company's website at www.celanese.com.       Forward-Looking Statements:     This release may contain "forward-looking statements," which include information concerning the Company's plans, objectives, goals, strategies, future revenues or performance, capital expenditures, financing needs and other information that is not historical information. When used in this release, the words "outlook," "forecast," "estimates," "expects," "anticipates," "projects," "plans," "intends," "believes," and variations of such words or similar expressions are intended to identify forward-looking statements. All forward-looking statements are based upon current expectations and beliefs and various assumptions. There can be no assurance that the Company will realize these expectations or that these beliefs will prove correct. There are a number of risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from the forward-looking statements contained in this release. Numerous factors, many of which are beyond the Company's control, could cause actual results to differ materially from those expressed as forward-looking statements. Certain of these risk factors are discussed in the Company's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Any forward-looking statement speaks only as of the date on which it is made, and the Company undertakes no obligation to update any forward-looking statements to reflect events or circumstances after the date on which it is made or to reflect the occurrence of anticipated or unanticipated events or circumstances. Headline: : Salesforce.com Chairman & CEO, Marc Benioff, to Speak at the Global Philanthropy Forum's 6th Annual Conference in Mountain View on Wednesday, April 11, 2007
Story: Salesforce.com Chairman & CEO, Marc Benioff, to Speak at the Global Philanthropy Forum's 6th Annual Conference in Mountain View on Wednesday, April 11, 2007     An Audio Webcast of Mr. Benioff's Panel Discussion Will Be Available on the Global Philanthropy Forum's Website           SAN FRANCISCO, April 6 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Salesforce.com  (NYSE: CRM), the market and technology leader in on-demand business services,  today announced that Marc Benioff, chairman and CEO of salesforce.com, will  speak on a panel at the Global Philanthropy Forum's (GPF) 6th Annual  Conference at the Google Campus in Mountain View on Wednesday, April 11, 2007  at 1:45pm (PDT)/4:45pm (EDT).          (Logo:  http://www.newscom.com/cgi-bin/prnh/20050216/SFW105LOGO)        The GPF is an international network of donors and social investors  pioneered by the World Affairs Council of Northern California. The GPF's 600  members come together from around the world in an annual meeting and at  smaller seminars to inform, enable and enhance the strategic nature of their  giving and social investing.        An audio webcast of Mr. Benioff's panel discussion will be available on  the Global Philanthropy Forum's website at www.philanthropyforum.org. In  addition, the panel will also be broadcast on the World Affairs Council's  radio program, It's Your World.          About Salesforce.com Foundation        The Salesforce.com Foundation mission is to remain the leaders in  pioneering, evangelizing and implementing the 1% Model, and using this model  as a means to improve the lives of people around the world.  The  Salesforce.com Foundation harnesses the power of product and people to improve  the lives of those in need. Using the unique 1/1/1/1 Model -- 1% Time, 1%  Equity, 1% Product, "one" with the earth -- the Foundation reaches out to the  community and increases the effectiveness of nonprofit organizations so they  can better achieve their goals. We call this the Power of Us. We concentrate  on the use of technology, specifically as it relates to organizations with  youth development programs. We have supported technology centers around the  world that help kids in technology-bereft urban and rural areas create a  better future for themselves. Since July of 2000, salesforce.com employees  have given over 40,000 hours of their time and expertise, feeding the  homeless, tutoring kids, improving nonprofit spaces, and offering hundreds of  helping hands when the world is faced with devastating natural disasters.          About salesforce.com        Salesforce.com is the market and technology leader in on-demand business  services.  The company's Salesforce suite of on-demand CRM applications allows  customers to manage and share all of their sales, support, marketing and  partner information on-demand. Apex, the world's first on-demand platform,  enables customers, developers and partners to build powerful new on-demand  applications that extend beyond CRM to deliver the benefits of multi-tenancy  and The Business Web across the enterprise.  All Apex components and  applications can be easily shared, exchanged and installed via  salesforce.com's AppExchange directory, available at  http://www.salesforce.com/appexchange.   Customers can also take advantage of  Successforce, salesforce.com's world-class training, support, consulting and  best practices offerings.        As of January 31, 2007, salesforce.com manages customer information for  approximately 29,800 customers and approximately 646,000 paying subscribers  including Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), America Online (AOL), Avis Budget  Group, Inc, Dow Jones Newswires, Polycom and SunTrust Banks. Any unreleased  services or features referenced in this or other press releases or public  statements are not currently available and may not be delivered on time or at  all. Customers who purchase salesforce.com applications should make their  purchase decisions based upon features that are currently available.  Salesforce.com has headquarters in San Francisco, with offices in Europe and  Asia, and trades on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "CRM".  For more information please visit http://www.salesforce.com, or call  1-800-NO-SOFTWARE.        NOTE:  Salesforce.com is a registered trademark of salesforce.com, and  Apex, AppExchange, The Business Web, IdeaExchange and Successforce are  trademarks of salesforce.com, Inc., San Francisco, California. Other names  used may be trademarks of their respective owners.      SOURCE  salesforce.com, Inc.          /CONTACT: Katy Dormer of salesforce.com, +1-415-901-8595, or kdormer@salesforce.com       /Web site: http://www.salesforce.com/          (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 17:25 ET (21:25 GMT)

Headline: Investors Win Higher Yields, Protection On Realogy Bonds
Story: (This article was originally published Thursday)         By Cynthia Koons and Michael Aneiro     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Investors, concerned about a softening housing market, forced real estate servicing company Realogy Corp. (H) to pay higher financing costs Thursday on its $3.15 billion junk-bond offering.   Deteriorating home sales amid a tightening of lending standards made investors more cautious about the already heavily-indebted Realogy, especially when the funds raised will finance the company's $6.6 billion leveraged buyout by private equity firm Apollo Management.   The deal, which was originally expected to price Thursday morning, officially sold late in the day after tough negotiations between the borrower and investors.   "Sometimes deals get so bad and you get the call from the issuer 'You tell us, what rate do you want,'" said a market participant, who did not want to be named for this article. "This isn't that bad, but it's sort of the next rung up."   Realogy paid double-digit rates on its debt, an usually high cost of financing in the current borrowers' market where investors have devoured debt from even the riskiest companies. The largest portion of the three-part deal, the $1.7 billion fixed-rate notes, commanded a 10.75% yield, a full percentage point higher than initial estimates.   The value of the bonds, however, rose modestly when they were free to trade in the secondary market soon after the sale.       The Apollo Clause     Investors also demanded special provisions to preempt any move by Realogy to take on additional debt to pay Apollo a dividend in the near future. Apollo Management is known for taking speedy, debt-funded dividends from the companies it acquires.   "All the covenants are being tightened up," said Justin Monteith, a market analyst at KDP Advisors. "They're kind of anti-Apollo covenants because basically the market's already uncomfortable with the housing sector so that's a sufficient risk factor. Then people are uncomfortable with (leveraged buyouts) in general, and this is a pretty highly levered one, and then to put the Apollo risk on top of that - their tradition of being bondholder unfriendly - it seems like a risk that people don't want to take."   Realogy declined to comment on the bond offering while Apollo did not return calls seeking comment.   Realogy is a real estate franchiser with brands including Century 21 and Coldwell Banker and also provides relocation services. While not largely exposed to the troubled subprime housing market, worries about a general slowdown in home sales kept investors at bay.   A fund manager who decided against buying the bonds said Realogy's sensitivity to the housing market was the sticking point.   As for the new provisions on the debt, a market participant said investors negotiated a "restricted payments" covenant, which would limit the company from being able to pay a dividend to the owners until the company cuts its debt load.   Dividends, especially debt-funded ones, aren't good for bondholders because it means a company's cash on hand isn't being used to pay down debt or finance operational improvements.   Including the new debt, Realogy's pro forma debt will be 10 times its adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization, or EBITDA, according to Standard & Poors.   The added protective provision requires Realogy to cut its debt to six times cash flow projections, including dividend-related debt, before paying out its private equity sponsor, according to market participants familiar with the terms of the offering.       Past Is Present     Realogy as a bond issuer isn't unfamiliar with covenant negotiations.   When the company still carried investment-grade ratings, investors won a provision that entitled them to a quarter-point increase in the coupon for every downgrade of the credit into junk. That covenant was included on a $1.2 billion offer in October.   Realogy is now rated well below investment-grade, with S&P putting it at B+ and Moody's Investors Service, at B3.   Investors also negotiated for a change of control covenant in the October offering, which means bondholders could sell their bonds back to Realogy at 100% of their principal amount - plus accrued and unpaid interest - as a result of changing ownership.   In its foray in the junk the market this week, Realogy also faced pushback on the $1.95 billion loan portion of the financing package. It was initially expected to sell at a rate of 225 basis points over the London Interbank Offered Rate, yet that guidance rose to 300 basis points over the course of negotiations, a market source said.       -By Cynthia Koons and Michael Aneiro, Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-5451; cynthia.koons@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 07:32 ET (11:32 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: KKR Admonishes TXU For Threatening To Shut Power Plants
Story: NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Two private equity groups that plan to purchase TXU Corp. (TXU) urged the company Friday to negotiate with Texas regulators and not carry out a threat to shut down power plants.   In response to charges by staff of the Public Utility Commission of Texas that TXU manipulated the Texas wholesale power market in 2005, the company warned Thursday that it it could be forced to shut down some power plants if it couldn't settle the charges.   Kohlberg, Kravis Roberts & Co. and TGP, which are leading a $32 billion buyout of TXU, said Friday they were not aware TXU was considering shutting down power plants and were opposed to such a course of action.   "TXU is not permitted to unilaterally shut down power plants," the firms said in a statement. "Such a step can only be done after a review by the(Electricity Reliability Council of Texas). There is no intention among the investor group to shut down plants, especially those needed to ensure reliability."   The firms said they would send a a letter to the commission "confirming these commitments."   TXU, the state's largest power generator, didn't say how many of its older, natural gas-fired plants it might close or turn over to other operators. But it warned that the state's wholesale electric market might be disrupted as a result.   Last week, the Public Utility Commission staff proposed a $210 million penalty against TXU over charges that during the summer of 2005 it sold power at inflated prices.   TXU has contested the charges, which come as the utility is trying to sell itself to KKR, TGP and a group of banks in what would be the largest leveraged buyout ever.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 15:17 ET (19:17 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE: KKR, TGP Disagree With Potential TXU Plant Shutdowns
Story: DALLAS (AP)--The private investors trying to buy TXU Corp. (TXU) distanced themselves Friday from the utility's threat to shut down some of its power plants if it can't settle accusations that it manipulated the Texas wholesale electric market.   TXU's letter earlier this week to state regulators mentioning potential power plant shutdowns "was not shared with the investor group in advance, and we strongly disagree with it," Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co. and Texas Pacific Group said in a statement.   The investors said they were "strongly advising TXU" to settle its dispute with regulators.   KKR and Texas Pacific are leading a group of investors trying to buy TXU for $32 billion in what would become the largest private buyout ever.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 15:02 ET (19:02 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE: Volkswagen 1Q Vehicle Sales In China, HK Up 23%
Story: (Adds sales data for Volkswagen-, Audi-branded vehicles.)     SHANGHAI (Dow Jones)--Volkswagen AG (VLKAY) said Friday its first-quarter vehicle sales in mainland China and Hong Kong rose 23% from the year-earlier period to 202,623 units.   Volkswagen Group China said in a statement its vehicle sales, including those from its two joint ventures, FAW-Volkswagen Automobile Co. and Shanghai Volkswagen Automotive Co., exceeded 200,000 units for the first time in a single quarter. In the first quarter of last year, sales totaled 164,708 units.   "The financial result in the first quarter is above the previous year's level and in line with the company's expectations," the statement said.   First-quarter sales of Volkswagen-branded vehicles, including 1,483 imports, rose 22.5% from the year-earlier period to 178,070 units, the company said.   It also sold 24,342 Audi vehicles, including 1,749 imports, a 27% increase from the year-earlier period.     -By Siobhain Ryan, Dow Jones Newswires; 8621 6120-1200; siobhain.ryan@dowjones.com       (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 01:59 ET (05:59 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Google, Agence France-Presse Sign Licensing Deal, Settle Suit
Story: NEW YORK (AP)--Agence France-Presse, a global news agency based in Paris, said Friday it has reached an agreement with Google Inc. (GOOG) that will allow the Internet-search leader to post news and photos from AFP.   The deal settles a copyright-infringement lawsuit that AFP filed in March 2005 accusing Google of posting news summaries, headlines and photos without permission.   Financial details of the settlement weren't disclosed.   The deal will allow Google to use headlines and photos on services including Google News and other Google pages, driving online traffic to sites that display AFP news. The companies didn't disclose where else AFP's news would be used by Google.   Google settled a separate dispute with the Associated Press last August. At that time the two companies disclosed a new business relationship under which Google will pay AP for news and photos, but financial details of that arrangement weren't disclosed.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 10:51 ET (14:51 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Allied Gets Go-Ahead For Chapter 11 Statement, $15M Loan
Story: By Kristina Doss     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     Allied Holdings Inc. scored two victories this week, winning bankruptcy court approval of its Chapter 11 plan-disclosure statement and its request to enter into a $15 million financing arrangement.   On Friday, the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Atlanta approved the disclosure statement, which describes the terms of Allied's Chapter 11 plan in nonlegal language.   The court's approval enables the automobile hauler to send its plan to creditors for a vote.   The court said votes are due by May 1 and the confirmation hearing will take place May 9.   In approving the disclosure statement, the court said the document contained adequate information.   Allied beefed up its statement with additional information after seven formal objections were filed by the Justice Department, a group of shareholders and other parties challenging its adequacy.   Among other things, Allied added a liquidation analysis and disclosed more information regarding the amount of the reorganized company's stock that its largest unsecured creditor, Yucaipa Cos., stands to receive under the proposal.   Allied's plan would give Yucaipa a stake in the reorganized company and allow the buyout firm to appoint three of the five members of Allied's post-bankruptcy board.   Unsecured creditors, who are owed $196.9 million, will be repaid with the reorganized Allied's stock. Secured creditors will be paid in full, but current shareholders will see their shares canceled and will recover nothing under the plan.   The proposed plan also incorporates a new labor deal Yucaipa reached with the Teamsters union, which represents most of Allied's 5,500 workers. The deal includes a 15% across-the-board pay cut over three years.   The proposed reorganization also includes the possible sale, subject to Yucaipa's approval, of Allied's Canadian operations.   Yucaipa's Performance Transportation Services Inc., an industry rival, would likely serve as the lead bidder for the Canadian operations if Allied chooses to sell.   Separately, the bankruptcy court on Thursday gave Allied interim approval to enter into a $15 million financing arrangement with a Yucaipa affiliate in order to revamp its aging fleet of tractor-trailers.   The company, which has been hit with higher-than-anticipated costs of repairing and maintaining its existing fleet, wants to buy a total of 150 tractor-trailers that another vehicle transporter is auctioning off.   According to Allied, it doesn't have the money to buy the tractor-trailers. But Yucaipa Transportation LLC has offered to buy them at the auction and sell them to Allied.   Also, Yucaipa Transportation will provide funds that will enable Allied to retrofit and repair the purchased equipment.   Allied Holdings, based in Decatur, Ga., filed for Chapter 11 protection on July 31, 2005. One of the largest vehicle transporters in North America, Allied blamed its financial troubles on a drop in deliveries resulting from decreased automobile production.     -Kristina Doss, Dow Jones Newswires; 202-862-1344; kristina.doss@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 13:54 ET (17:54 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Santa Fe Energy Trust Gets Letter From NYSE For 10K Delay
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     Santa Fe Energy Trust (SFF) said Friday that it received a letter from the New York Stock Exchange notifying the company that it has failed to satisfy a contined listing rule as a result of its delayed annual report.   According to a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the exchange will monitor the status of the trust's annual report filing and related disclosures for up to six months, and could allow it up to an additional six months to file.   NYSE may begin delisting at any time during the period it has allowed Santa Fe Energy Trust to complete the filing "if the circumstances warrant," the filing said.   Austin-based Santa Fe Energy Trust said last month that it delayed the Form 10K for 2006 because Devon Energy Corp. (DVN) believes it may have overpaid the trust during 2006 and prior years for net profit royalties.   -Yogita Patel, Dow Jones Newswires; 202-862-1343; yogita.patel@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 10:08 ET (14:08 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: New Century: Court Approves $50M DIP Financing >NEWC
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   New Century Financial Corp. (NEWC) said the U.S. Bankruptcy Court for the District of Delaware has approved up to $50 million of debtor-in-possession financing.   The Irvine, Calif., real estate investment trust, which on Monday filed for bankruptcy protection, said the court allowed it, on an interim basis, to access up to $50 million of the $150 million in financing arranged by CIT Group Inc. (CIT) and Greenwich Capital Financial Products Inc.   New Century said Judge Kevin J. Carey also approved motions allowing the company to continue customer programs, including a restitution plan, the funding of manufactured home loans under a federal program, and to continue employee benefits programs and insurance policies.   The court scheduled a hearing for April 10 to consider the bidding process for New Century's agreement to sell servicing assets and platforms to Carrington Capital Management LLC and to sell loans and interests in securitization trusts to Greenwich Capital Financial Products for an aggregate price of $50 million.   -Sara Leitch; 201-938-5400; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 09:30 ET (13:30 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Columbia Bancorp Puts 1Q EPS At 33c-35c, Below Views >CBBO
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Columbia Bancorp (CBBO) Friday said it expects to report first-quarter earnings of 33 cents to 35 cents a share, below the 41 cents a share expected by analysts.   The Oregon-based bank holding company attributed the shortfall to compression of its net interest margin, which Columbia said is a consistent issue facing banks across the country.   "As we continue to experience a stationary Fed Funds rate and hear uncertain economic news about the housing market and volatile oil prices, management expects our yield on earning assets to remain fairly flat for the remainder of 2007," Columbia said.   The company said it also expects increasing competition for core deposits, which will likely cause an increase in its cost of funds.   Columbia said it expects its provision for loan losses for the first quarter to be in the range of $950,000 and $1.05 million, reflecting adjustments to the allowance for loan losses resulting in part from a $1 million charge-off of a loan to a single borrower. Columbia said it has reached a settlement with the borrower, and that it is sufficiently reserved for the settlement.   -Colin M. Kellaher; 201-938-5400; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 03:14 ET (07:14 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Keane Gets NYSE Letter Regarding Delayed Annual Report >KEA
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     Keane Inc. (KEA) said Friday that it recently got a letter from the New York Stock Exchange notifying the company that it has failed to satisfy a continued-listing rule as a result of its delayed 2006 annual report.   If Keane hasn't filed the report on Form 10-K within six months of the deadline, the NYSE could allow the company's securities to be traded for up to six more months, or begin suspension and delisting procedures.   According to a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the exchange will monitor the status of Keane and its filing of the 2006 annual report.   Keane said it also received a second purported notice of default from a holder of more than 25% of the company's of 2% convertible subordinated debentures due in 2013 because the company hasn't submitted the annual report.   If Keane doesn't remedy the default under the indenture, the holders of 25% or more of the debentures could declare the outstanding amount and interest immediately due and payable 60 days after the second notice, received Tuesday.   Keane had $150.9 million outstanding, including interest, of the debentures as of March 31. The company would also be obligated to pay up to $17.9 million in taxes in connection with any accelerated payment, the filing said.   A default under the indenture also would trigger a default under Keane's credit agreement, under which the company has $36.2 million outstanding in letters of credit.     -Yogita Patel, Dow Jones Newswires; 202-862-1343; yogita.patel@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 12:59 ET (16:59 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: MARKET TALK/Europe: Roundup of Stocks, Mkt Activity
Story: 1543 GMT [Dow Jones] Puma (PUM.XE) continues its rally late Thursday, trading +10% at EUR313.80. "This doesn't look like the usual pre-weekend takeover talk," says a trader. "Something must be going on," he adds. Adds it could also be that someone is buying into the stock to increase their voting rights ahead of the company's AGM Wednesday. Next resistance is pegged at EUR320. Puma declines to comment. (MOD/JUM)     1423 GMT [Dow Jones] Credit Suisse upgrades Atos Origin (5173.FR) to neutral from underperform and raises price target to EUR49.00 from EUR37.00 as KKR's (KFN) bid of $29B on First Data (FDC) "sets a firm valuation benchmark" for Atos Origin's Worldline unit. Credit Suisse adds private equity interest lifts the bank's valuation of the company. Notes the company is exploring "strategic options" and expects the "process to conclude in a short timeframe," likely in the next two weeks, says Credit Suisse. Shares trade +4.3% at EUR52.30. (ACD)     1317 GMT [Dow Jones]--PUMA (PUM.XE) +7.4% at EUR306.10, topping the list of MDax advancers. A trader says there is talk Pinault-Printemps (12148.FR) may be interested in PUMA. Another traders adds speculation Adidas (ADS.XE) is interested is still circulating. A technical trader notes buy-stops at the EUR301 level have shored up the stock's horizontal movement. "Stops from breakout-buyers have all gathered at this level," he says. Puma declines to comment on market speculation. A spokesperson from Pinault-Printemps declines to comment on market speculation. Next resistance for Puma is seen at EUR310. (MOD/APB)     1310 GMT [Dow Jones] Sal Oppenheim initiates Fuchs Petrolub (FPE.XE) at buy, with EUR69 fair value for ordinary shares. Due to continued profit expansion via organic growth, combined with further optimization of the cost structure, brokerage is confident the shares will reward shareholders for the foreseeable future. Notes a streamlining of the regional organization has removed considerable costs and given it sustainable profitability. Shares +0.1% at EUR66.34. (JAS)    Contact us in London. +44-20-7842-9464  Markettalk.eu@dowjones.com       (END) Dow Jones Newswires  April 06, 2007 09:10 ET (13:10 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.
